text: Bottle @Bir&Fud Bottega (Rome). Dorata carica, leggermenete torbida, schiuma media molto abbondante e persistente. Al naso sentori di frutta gialla, esteri, lieviti, spezie, scorza dÂ’arancia. In bocca ha un attacco maltato dolce, ancora spezie, finale amaro con note erbacee. Corpo medio, carbonazione media. Un poÂ’ sgraziata.

330ml bottle at home on 17 Jan 2017, from Cornelius, Easter Road, Edinburgh, spicy, yeasty aroma, straw with a large foamy off-white head, fruity, citrus, yeasty, light spice, oily, quite fizzy, bitter finish.

tap/strefa piwa. jasnoÅ¼Ã³Å‚te, klarowne, z grubÄ…, drobnopÄ™cherzykowÄ… pianÄ… utrzymujÄ…ca siÄ™ do koÅ„ca picia. aromaty funky, koÅ„ska derka, owocowoÅ›Ä‡ od estrÃ³w, po ogrzaniu wyraÅºne cytrusy i sosna. w smaku peÅ‚ne, gÅ‚adkie, sÅ‚odko-gorzkie, szybko znika ze szklanki

Courtesy of Jaghana. Couleur jaune dorÃ©e, lÃ©gÃ¨re mousse. Nez lÃ©gÃ¨rement fruitÃ© , raisin avec legumes et levures belges un peu moisies. Gout raisin dÃ©passÃ© par levures, tige verte, amertume agrumes levures vielles. Bref les saisons ca nÂ’a jamais Ã©tÃ© mon style.

Bottle 66cl, a yellow beer with huge head and retention. Nose is intense on grapefruit, green vegetables, unmatured lemon. Aroma is in the same with kat piss touch, very astringent, green vegetables, quite bitter. Just ugly and unbalanced.
On tap. Gold with white head. Aroma of oranges, saison yeast, apricot. Juicy fruits sweet flavour, spicy hoppy bitter finish

Botella 33cl en el Grifo Plaza del grano Leon 18..09..2016. Lote B000181 hasta 30..12..2016. (r64). Color Ã¡mbar miel anaranjado turbio con espuma blanca Aromas y sabores maltosos algo dulces melosos y afrutados con amargo algo Ã¡spero seco y resinoso al final mÃ¡s o menos duradero. Cuerpo medio algo pastoso y espumoso con buena sensaciÃ³n alcohÃ³lica. 6.7 vol apreciables. no estÃ¡ mal. Buena.

Light Amber hue. Earthy nose. Fruit & funk on the tongue with a bitter finish. An interesting blend of the two styles.

Rated by BrewTom

Licht wazig oranjegeel bier met kleine witte schuimkraag.
Aroma: zoet graan en brood malts, licht fruit, abrikoos, mandarijn, zoete sinaasappel. 
Smaak: Belgische gist, droge bitterheid, licht zuur, fruitig, abrikozen, meloen, mango.
Gemiddeld mondgevoel met weinig koolzuur en licht bittere afdronk.

Bottle from Brewdog. Pours hazy golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma is fruity, with citrus and tropical fruits and some yeast. Taste is mild malty, with moderate fruity elements, light dry and bitter as well. High carbonated, resiny herbal finish with a touch of citrus and grassy hops.

Sweet grain and bread malts, molasses, dry sweets, light fruits, apricot, tangerine, sweet orange. Hazy gold, small, creamy, white head. Light bitter. Belgian yeast, dry bitterness, light sour, fruity, apricots, melon, mango, dry, bitter finish. Very nice IPA/Saison/Belgian Ale, great mixture of Belgian yeast and fruity hops. Bottle from BottleDog, Holborn.

330ml bottle from the brewer via Eebria. Pours hazy yellow with large off-white head. Aroma is spicy Belgian yeast. Taste is spicy, fuzzy, with nice fruity grapefruit / exotic fruit notes. Very nice saison.

Bottle 33cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Hazy golden.
T: Malt, fruity, citrusy, slightly yeasty.
Bottled 33cl. Color : hazy golden ale with thin white head. Nose : citrus and exotic fruits. Aromas : fruits, exotic and citrus. Nice bitterness.

Pours hazy yellow with thin white head. Nose is tropical fruits and citrus. Aromas are citrus, tropical fruits, bubble gum, herbal hops. Average carbonation, medium body. Long fruity and bitter finish

Bottled. Pours clear deep golden with an average off-white head. Aroma of funky notes, tropical fuit and resin notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodsied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice and hoppy Saison ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

330 mml bottle tasted on the 28/05/2016. Hazy orange colour with a thick white head. Aroma of hops, yeast, passionfruit and more hops. Taste is fruity and hoppy. Medium sweet and intense bitterness. Next one please!

7.2ï¼…ABV. Â Stout.

Poured out black. Â 40ÂºSRM.

Nose is smoky and ume with a nice dryness. Some sulfite with some faint eggshell. Some dates in the nose. Â Some nice clean charcoal. Â Cough syrup with some sweet medicinal-ness.

Mouthfeel is thin soap. Â Palate is darkly roasted malt with smoke, char with its attendant bitterness. Â A little alcoholic on the back of the throat with some warmth. Finishes off with some ripe blackberries. Â overall the palate is really all about sweet, smoke and bitter and then sweet again. Â 70% or more cacao dark chocolate?

Really nice.

Goes on Favorites List!
Bottle. Orange appearance with a small head.Fruity with hops in background.Subtle bitter flavour with hops in background. Very pleasant although not quite sure what style it is.

(Draught at Craft Beer Islington, London, 22 April 2016) Hazy golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty, fruity nose with citrus, tropical fruit, resin and a slightly earthy yeast touch. Malty, fruity taste with notes of pineapple, citrus, grapefruit, lemon peel, resin, grass and a generous citric bitterness. Medium body, with a certain sweetness. Tasty and well made, with a generous hop presence and a balanced saison character. Nice one.

33cl bottle at home from Brewdog. Nose is fresh fruity, grass. Body is hazy orange, head is small, white, rocky, mostly lasting, good lacing. Aroma is spicies, weed, leaves, wood, yeast, sweat. Light sweet, light bitter, medium umami. Finish is long lasting medium umami, slightly salty, slowly developing hoppy bitter, light alcohol warmth. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation. Very weird, unique, I donÂ’t really like it but very interesting, great one.
Pale orange with a thin white head. Green bitterness, a bit of sourness, farmhouse funk, unripe mango, gooseberries and yeast. Dry and bitter. A damn good saison.

Keg shared at the big Dave tasting at craft beer Co Islington. Many thanks to Daniel? Hazed light yellow orange coloured pour with a a small white head. Aroma is canned pineapple, hockey puck, orange rind, semi juicy. Palate is medium full sticky resinous, grainy. Flavour is composed of pale grains, little hay, apricot and some mixed tropical fruit.

Keg at CBC Islington as Â’Tempest Harvest IPA- Mosaic SaisonÂ’. Hazy orange, still, dense foamy white head. Aroma is tangerine, spicy, wheat, coriander. Body is light, tingly carbonation, a little foamy. Taste is tangerine, spicy, esters, dry wheat. Not bad. (3.6)
A gift. Bottle at home. Pours hazy golden nice head nice lacing. Spicy rich orange and pine hop aromas. Quite rustic tangy fruitiness. Tangerine pith. Yeast. Bready. Dry bitter finish. Very nice

330ml bottle shared with Roger at BrewDog Castlegate. A bubbly white head to a cloudy golden body. Fair lacing. Fresh juicy fruits on the nose. Blossom citrus flavours followed by citrus peels towards a drying bitter finish. Well bodied. Refreshing with splendid drinkability (Aberdeen 19.04.2016).

keg at CBC Islington, London. It pours a hazed golden color with a small white head. Aroma is full of tangy sweet fruit notes with loads of weed onion grapefruit and peaches. Taste is also medium sweet with notes of peaches weed apricots melon citrus and a tangy citric finale. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, excellent

Keg at CBC Islo, 21/04/16.
Lightly gazed orange golden with a decent off White head.
Nose is bitter orange, tangerine , funk, apricot, pissy strokes. 
Taste comprises apricot jam, bitter orange, straw, juicy citric tinged straw. 
Medium bodied , fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid juicy drool.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg at CBC Islington - London. Pours mostly clear gold with a creamy, white head. The nose has a nice blend of saison yeast and citrusy hops. Medium sweet flavour with lots of juicy citrus and tropical fruits, mango, peach, orange, apricot, some pale bread, light hay, more yeast. Meod bodied with fine to average carbonation. Juicy tropical fruit finish, with more saison yeast, melon, peach. Really tasty stuff.

330ml bottle. Hazy gold amber, white foam head leaving lacing and aroma of grains, passionfruit, citrus hop. Taste is malt caramel, grainy, fruity, melon, citrus, woody, yeast, spicy bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry bitter finish. Quite drinkable.

Bottle. Golden, hazy, average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate malty - lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish aroma, faint caramel and light - some tropical/flora fruitiness, some citrus - light grapefruit hoppyness. Body is light to medium, malty- lightly wheaty and dryish flavor, faint caramel and light tropical/floral fruitiness, some citrus/grapefruit hoppyness. Finish is average, malty - lightly wheaty and dryish, faint caramel and light floral fruitiness, light - some citrus hoppyness. Thin IPA/saison/Belgian ale/or whatever this one is.I am not big fan of wheat combined with bitterness. Waste of good hops - brew for the meek.

330ml bottle. Hazy, orangey golden colour with average, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, white head. Sweet-ish, bready malty aroma, fruity hoppy overtones, hints of passion fruit, yellow stone fruit, quince, mild, peppery yeasty spiciness. Taste is dry, moderately bitter hoppy, tropical fruity and slightly bready malty, some peppery yeasty spiciness, fruity hints of yellow stone fruit, quince, a touch of passionfruit. Very nice composition, superb drinkability, lacks some strength and intensity to reach absolute top level.
UPDATED: MAR 19, 2016 33cl bottle from saveur-biere. hazy gold color. Thin white head. Light sweetness, medium bitterness. Aroma is earthy, fruity, herby, hops. Pretty tasty.

Golden body, small head. Very fruity aroma, banana, wheat, peach, typical Belgian ale. Not saison like at all, or ipa. Was that the intention? Fairly clean fermentation, typical tripel like malts actually, and even a warming body like that, although the hops are more modern. Tasty and different brew for sure, although the named style makes no sense. ItÂ’s perhaps not what I wanted to drink right now, but well executed stuff. Just, is this really mosaic? I donÂ’t find it. (33cl bottle from Saveur BiÃ¨re)
Bottle shared. Apricot mango, tropical fruit nose. Very juicy. Flavour follows nose with juicy fruit finish. Lovely full flavour.

Growler from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Amber/gold pour with a white head. Lots of apricot, peach and tropical fruit in the nose. Bittersweet fruit action in the flavour. Light bitter finish. Good stuff.

330ml bottle from Saveur-Biere. Pours orange with a foamy head. Aroma of funky yeast, farmyard, hints of fruits, spices, earthiness and citrus. Taste is hoppy, fruity and floral with some funky Belgian yeastiness, earthiness, spiciness and citrusy notes. Finish is hoppy, yeasty and slightly bitter with hints of earthiness, spices and floral notes. Pretty tasty hoppy saison.

Hazy light orange color with white head. Aroma has fruity hops but also some fruity yeast esters. I get stonefruits and some earthy funk notes. Taste starts fruity and yeasty, very balanced at first, gets more bitter towards the finish and lingers on the aftertaste. Body and carbonation are medium. You get the bitterness and hoppiness of an IPA but overall itÂ’s leaning more towards the saison style.

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Hazy straw coloured with a thick head of white foam. It has a tart citrus, lemon and zesty fruity flavour followed by vanilla and more tart lemon on the finish. This is certainly a Saison rather than an IPA.

Fruity and floral hoppy aroma and taste, some nice farmyard notes, orange and lemon citrus, light herbal floral into the finish. Nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Crafty Bottle, Lincoln. Hazy deep golden colour, with a white head. Tropical fruit, citrus and yeasty aroma. Taste is light sweet with a mid bitterness.

330ml bottle from Good Spirits Co. Wine & Beer. Hazy pale yellow, reasonable head. Bitter leafy grain hop aroma. Leafy yeasty resin grapefruit flavour. Bitter citrus aftertaste. Complex IPA Saison hybrid. Not really a Belgian Ale.

27th January 2015Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is smooth, fairly dry and has modest fine carbonation. A light malt base, mild thin sweetness. Skunky hops. Spicy esters. Ripe fruits. Mild marmalade. Light and spicy finish. Hoppy but quite estery. So what is this? An IPA or a Saison? Belgian Ale seems like the least likely candidate!
Bottle, Brewdog Leicester. Hazy golden orange with a large foam. Oranges and lemon with spritzy yeast. Tropical fruit with sudsy notes. Floral with a solid barnyard character. Very good.
Bottle at home. Malty sweet. Nice yeasty nose and some citrus. Medium body. Delightful.
Dorado turbio con espuma blanca compacta. Aromas intensos de manzana verde, pino, toque cÃ­trico, pan. Cuerpo medio, sabor intenso de manzana verde, lima, menta y final de amargor seco largo.
Bottle at home, 9th January 2016. Pours hazy yellow. Aroma is fresh hops, some Belgian yeast, pine resin. Taste is citrus bitterness infused with Belgian yeast and pine. Refreshing Hybrid IPA
Nice citrus, canned apricots and cat pee (in a good way) aromas. Bit sweet but smooth bitterness grows after. Taste is complex with layers of citrus, hay, grass and herbs.

Bottle at home from cornelius Edinburgh a hazy golden beer with yeasty aroma flavour is tropical fruits aromatic spice yeasty notes with some green apple hops simplified this is a very good cross between a new world ipa and a saison

Bottle at the family Christmas gathering. Pours a hazy golden with a medium off-white lasting head. Aroma is marmalade, lemon sherbet, unripened orange. Taste is tarte green apple, melon, lemon, grapefruit, slight maltyness, slight bitter dry finish, big yeasty flavours. Absolutely lovely, nice sourness to this, the yeast works wonders.

bottle at home from aleselaFantastic bright berry and melon aromas on the nose, full bodied, lightly funky, high carbonation, dry with moderate bitterness but all about redcurrants, orange peel pithiness, slightly dieselly fresh and moreish, wish iÂ’d bought two

Bottle thanks to Lorna, picked up at Beer Central - Sheffield. It pours hazy bright gold with a small white head. The nose is sweet-spicy, very juicy, peachy, apricot, tangerine, cracker, marmalade and cereal. The taste is crisp, bitter, spicy, cracker, cereal, peach, apricot, some alcohol heat, grassy vibe, pepper, straw and grapefruit with a clean, dry finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Juicy, well-balanced and highly drinkable. Very good.

Brown bottle, 330ml, cork and cask, Edinburgh. Pours medium golden hazy translucent with a thin thin white head subsiding slowly. Scent is medium lemon zest and Saison yeast with a nice complexity. Taste is dense Saison yeast and a bit of hops. Really interesting. Finish is a little bitter but simple. Great.

Bottle. Beer Central, Sheffield. Hazy gold. Decent, lasting, clingy, white head. Aroma is bready and lemony. Some peachy hop. Some mango in there. Pretty earthy. Some minty herb. Taste is chewy sweet. Has an earthy bitterness that rises. Full body. Quite oily. Finish is mostly pithy, earthy bitter. More of the sweetness on the close. DoesnÂ’t quite come together for me.
Origin: Tap. Vessel: Tulip. Supplier: Small Bar (Bristol). Tart and tight with citrus hints.

This really is a fantastic beer. I poured it carefully and got a nice hazy lemon-yellow IPA. In my opinion this is not a classic saison, but more of a fusion beer. It is essentially a single-hop IPA with Belgian yeast. The yanks have mastered this style and this compares very favourably. 
Take a big whiff to start and youÂ’ll get some tart lemon and grapefruit and a nice floral component. The mouthfeel is medium-bodied, which is just what IÂ’m looking for, and the citrus flavours almost make you screw your face theyÂ’re so real and tarte; mixing with the Belgian yeat you get a little earty spiciness. The bitterness is clean and the finish long - as soon as one giant gulp of this great grog goes down, you just want another. IÂ’d drink this all day if the gits would pull their finger out and find a distributor in Nottigham. Buy this beer if you can.

Hazy and pale greyed golden. Thin white cap. Nose is pungent, fresh grated citrus and fleshy grapefruit with a creamy backdrop. Initial taste isnÂ’t far off, rich and yearning bitterness throughout. Carbination is firm but aids a lucid mouthfeel. Finishes rich stewed lemon, creamy and punchy tropical zing at the same time. Incredibly strung out drying linger with a zip of tartness. A pretty superb combo here. Bottle, Cornelius

Bottle BBE: 28 Aug 2016. Chilled. Pours a hazy gold-amber body with a small, patchy off-white head. Medium-high intensity nose bursting with citrus fruit, midget gems, key lime pie, white bread and a sort of zesty, Sauvignon Blanc character. A medium citric sourness dominates the taste buds over a light, biscuity sweetness. Light bodied, with a delicate, silky texture and medium-low carbonation. ThereÂ’s a slightly boozy, warming finish. Truly bursting with fruity flavours - like eating a packet of fruit gums - without any real accompanying harshness. However, the mosaic hop character is so dominant that it hides the rest that this beer undoubtedly has to offer.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. 
Appearance - hazy golden amber with a decent head. The head doesnÂ’t hang around too long. 
Nose - lime and fresh sweat. 
Taste - very tangy lime, in fact the saison yeast gets it into lime pickle. Savoury and lightly spice. 
Palate - light to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - complex and refreshing even if a bit gnarly.

Cloudy light straw colour. Some very fluffy white head. Super hoppy zingy nose. Starts as a bitterish IPA on the palate and then transforms into a saisony fruityzing. Long lingering just bitter end. Tres nice.

Bottle kindly donated by BenH, merci beaucoup! Pours straight canary yellow with a large white had which largely remain - definitely a Belgian IPA. Aroma is pungent; packed with citrus, lime, slight pepper and a sprinkling of basil. Taste is grapefruit, mango, slight caramel, slight earthiness, slight peppery heat, a mellow bitterness which soon ceases and some slight persimmon sweetness. Aroma and taste are two separate entities here and its quite exciting.
Bottle. Very pale beer with a thin white head. Lots of clean grapefruit and peach flavour. Pretty dry throughout. Not as much saison yeast influence as I was expecting.

330ml bottle from Tempest. 
Big bubbly white head, nice lacing. Clear pale golden body. Nose is apricot, stone fruit, syrup. Flavour is stone fruit, yeast, malty biscuit. Hints of citrus. Stewed fruit aftertaste. Good mouthfeel, a little oily, slightly sticky finish, light carbonation.

Bottle From Bottle Baron, Edin. Pours ever-so-slightly hazy. Straw coloured. Pearly white head. Dank aromas in the glass. Definite saison yeasty character. Light funk. Offset well by the skunky fresh aromas of Mosaic hops. Some Hubba Bubba notes. Bit of lychee. Over-ripe mango. Quite sweaty after sitting in the glass for a bit. Medium to full body. Creamy carbonation. Taste has more yeast notes upfront. Grassy. Flinty. Citrus twist. Like flat lemonade. Nice balance of sweet malts and bitterness. Dry finish. Quite a punchy saison but I do feel the yeast character hides the full effect of the Mosaic hops
Bottle at Calton hill. Tastes herbs, citrus, peach, lime. Strongish tasty saison.

Bottle. pale yellow with white head. Absolutely stinks of the hops from 2 feet away, heavy peach and grapefruit up front, some musty lemon as well, some slightly peppery yeast. Taste of peach and grapefruit, under-ripe mango. Dry and very bitter, long bitter finish. D-lish
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours clear pale amber, nose is floral, citrus, taste is sweet, lemon and lime, toffee.
Keg at the hanging bat... Copper.. Thin white lacing.. Soft sweet fruits... Soft toffee fruit nose... Soft woody fruits... Light bitter fruits.. Soft herbal fruits

Bottle from The Beerhive. Hazy golden body with a thin white head. Light lacing. Aroma of lime chutney, pine, cloudy lemonade and tangerine. Flavour of orange, a hint of marmalade, sweet malts and bitter lemon. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft carbonation prickle. Delicious. More of an IPA than a Saison, in my view.
6.7 Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours hazy yellow gold with a thin white head. Aromas of lemon and lime, big citrus party. Taste is more lime and lemon. Dry, zingy finish. Easy drinking too.
